author: josekalel
title: Worth the Money but Not an Exciting Build
review:
Polybags are usually great to increase the size of your population (both people and cars) in your town, but that does not mean all the polybags are made the same.

Hot Rod #30354, is one of the latest. Although it is a very simple build, there is nothing exciting about it, no out of the ordinary techniques, but only a few cool pieces (for cars). The minifig does not even sit properly unless his hands are way up. 

If you see this, buy it, but don't expect much.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Perfect for Classic Car Show
review:
Set #30354 Hot Rod: Another fun looking LEGO City Polybag set, with a bit of a lackluster piece count, however still retaining some interesting elements and also isn’t just another police or firefighter inspired set. We’ll cover pros and cons and then get to the overall thoughts in the end.

Pros:

  • Hot Rod model uses some fun looking pieces.

  • Minifigure included is standard LEGO City faire.

  • Design works well, colour choices are nice as well with a predominantly red colour scheme that draws your eye and pops when on display.

  • Model is also extremely fun to roll around and play with once built.

Cons:

  • Price-per-Piece ratio looks terrible. LEGO City polybags seem to suffer the most with a 5$ overall price point, in a way it’s like you’re paying for a Minifigure with a really big accessory, which doesn’t always work out well.

  • Scale of Hot Rod vehicle a bit on the small side when compared with other LEGO City cars.

Overall opinion

As with most LEGO City polybags it’s rare not to find something to like, while the price is asking a bit much at times I will admit that more often than not the LEGO Designers do a fairly good job of creating a small model to go with a Minifigure. This Hot Rod polybag is rather fun, and while I’m still not a fan of the less than 40 piece counts with LEGO City polybags compared to some of the better Super Heroes or Star Wars polybags, I still wholeheartedly recommend a lot of LEGO City Polybags as they make very good desk toys.

So, I definitely recommend this set. I would however caution you to try and get it on sale during a discount period.
